pros: Friendly environment to work in.

pros: Flexibility and great staff support.
cons: There are none that I experienced.

pros: Some colleagues are very nice. It’s a rewarding job if you can manage the system, stress, and last minute chaos.
cons:
1. Lack of appropriate infrastructure. Wifi, email, library resources are inadequate. If you can’t get into your email, you can’t reset it yourself, you have to reach an IT person. 
2. Basically an open enrollment school so students take a lot of time and effort. Teaching load is high. Advising load is impossible with the teaching load.
3. Most administrators have never worked anywhere else so they are oblivious to best practices and have an inbred attitude—this is how we do it at GSU.
4. Administrators will lie to you to get you to work there—then forget their promises. So if you must decide to work there, get everything correct and in writing before you start.
5. Since they are willing to lie to get you there, they are certainly willing to be dishonest once you’re there. 
6. Getting anything done is worse than pulling teeth. There is an exorbitant amount of red tape—three or four people have to sign off in everything. The president even has to sign off on some travel expenses.
7. Everything happens at the last minute—everything!! They can send you an email and expect to you to receive the email (dubious with the email system) and expect you to attend a required meeting or training or submit a detailed document in less than 24 hours.
8. No room for advancement because incompetent people are allowed to sit in positions for years—some department chairs don’t know how to use a computer—in 2022!
9. Medical benefits are also dubious. Electing and paying for a PPO is no guarantee that you will receive the coverage you pay for. Even though they make changes to the plans, you are only allowed to opt out once a year.

review_title: GSU Rich in Tradition...Still Untapped Potential
pros: Rich in history with employees, alumni, community and constituents who really love the Institution and want to see it thrive. New President with excellent potential.
cons: Accountability for all levels is lacking; tremendous lack of teamwork throughout the Institution with very little collaboration amongst departments. Overall opposition to change makes it hard for changes that would really make the University better to become reality. Too many people content to carry own with business as usual. Very low employee morale.

job_title: Benjamin Quarles Endowed Professor of History in Grambling, LA
pros: Good family environment, no issues with salary/pay  it is always on time, mostly friendly people and generally a good work environment
cons: consistent competition and alienation among academic depts, the university is mal-organised from top to bottom, there is an insistent aire of anti-intellectualism which undermines the mission of the institution, many people thoroughly unqualified particularly in the leadership/administration (dept chairs/coordinators, deans, vp's)

review_title: not where you would want to be
pros: good environment to  work in.  The facilities are great.  You will love the beautiful whether  and the food is great. I would recommend that you live in the adjacent city of ruston
cons: The pay is bad and the management is not professional at all.  If you have young children you will find it hard to find a good daycare center.  The high schools are terrible.  The have a high dropout rate and poor facilities.
